page.title: 07POPULATION
page.content: { Haydock}grew because of the mining industry. In 1801 the population was only 734; by 1851 it had increased by 272% to 1994, due to the expansion of its mining, under the control of the {Evans}family. By the early 1920's the community size was 10333,a 518% growth that was to increase only slightly in the next 40 years, with the closing down of the mines. The{recent}growth in the area has been due mainly to the completion of the{East Lancs Road}and later the advent of a series of major road intersections, M62 and M6,and the establishment of an{industrial estate} in the early 1950's bringing much needed firms to the area. The movement into the area is reflected by the dramatic growth of 2 new housing estates at Chain Lane and Legh Road since the late 1960's.
